prefix: Approach the following question the way someone in high school would.
problem_prompt: Approach the following question the way someone in high school would. Find the product of $10101_2$ and $101_2$. Express your answer in base $2$.
solution:
Carry out the multiplication as you would with base $10$. There is no need to carry during the multiplication with base $2$.

$$\begin{array}{c@{}c@{}c@{}c@{}c@{}c@{}c@{}c@{}c} &&&&1&0&1&0&1_2\\ &&&&&\times&1&0&1_2\\ \cline{2-9} &&&_1&1^{\text{ }}&0^1&1^{\text{ }}&0^{\text{ }}&1^{\text{ }}_2\\ &+&1^{\text{ }}&0^{\text{ }}&1&0_{\text{ }}&1&0&0_2\\ \cline{2-9} &&1&1&0&1&0&0&1_2\\ \end{array}$$Add it up for a final answer of $\boxed{1101001_2}$.
gpt_response:
To find the product of $10101_2$ and $101_2$, we can use the method of multiplying binary numbers just like we do with decimal numbers.

\[
\begin{array}{c@{}c@{}c@{}c@{}c@{}c@{}c@{}c@{}c}
& & & 1 & 0 & 1 & 0 & 1 & (10101_2)\\
\times & & & & & 1 & 0 & 1 & (101_2)\\
\hline
& & & 1 & 0 & 1 & 0 & 1 & (10101_2)\\
& & 0 & 0 & 0 & 0 & 0 & 0 &\\
+ & 1 & 0 & 1 & 0 & 1 & & &\\
\hline
& 1 & 1 & 1 & 1 & 1 & 0 & 1 & (111101_2)\\
\end{array}
\]

Therefore, $10101_2 \times 101_2 = 111101_2$. So, the product of $10101_2$ and $101_2$ is $111101_2$ in base $2$.
